title: Active Few-Shot Learning with Fine-Tuning and Instance Selection for Natural Language Processing Tasks
author: Saeed Ahmadnia (University of Illinois Chicago), Arash Yousefi Jordehi (University of Guilan), Mahsa Hosseini Khasheh Heyran (University of Guilan), Seyed Abolghasem Mirroshandel (University of Guilan), Owen Rambow (Stony Brook University), Cornelia Caragea (University of Illinois Chicago), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses Few-Shot Learning (FSL) methods, which could enhance the capabilities of machine learning models in audio processing by using limited labeled examples. This approach can be applied to audio-related NLP tasks, potentially aiding in tasks like speech recognition.
background: Active few-shot learning involves using a small number of labeled examples to effectively train models, with a focus on selecting the most informative samples from a larger pool of unlabeled data.
contribution: This paper introduces an active learning-based instance selection mechanism to enhance fine-tuning in Few-Shot Learning scenarios, achieving improved classification performance across multiple NLP tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often used random sampling for instance selection, leading to inconsistent performance improvements when additional samples were added.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work proposes a systematic framework for selecting more informative samples through entropy and clustering techniques, enhancing model performance without requiring extensive labeled datasets.

key_innovation: Integrates active learning with fine-tuning techniques to iteratively select the most useful examples from unlabeled data, thereby minimizing annotation costs and improving model accuracy.
real_world_impact: The proposed method could significantly reduce the resources needed for training effective NLP models, making them more accessible for applications in various industries, including healthcare and customer service.
limitations: No limitations explicitly mentioned by the author.

new_terms.Few-Shot Learning: **Few-Shot Learning (FSL)** refers to the ability of a model to learn and generalize from a very limited number of training examples.
new_terms.Active Learning: **Active Learning** is a machine learning approach where the model interactively queries a user or some other information source to obtain the desired outputs at new data points.
